intro: Symphydolon, commonly known as the golden bell, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Styracaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with smooth, dark green leaves. Native to the eastern United States, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
